channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Insurrection Act: Why is Trump threatening to use military in Minnesota?
‘Can men get pregnant?’: Who is Dr Nisha Verma at centre of heated abortion hearing in US?
Internet ban at home, unrest outside: How bloody crackdown on protesters is making it hard to flee Iran
Is Donald Trump taking a step back on Iran?
How rising hate against Indians has rocked US companies like Walmart
Is Pakistan risking its financial system to stay in Trump’s good books?
China in Africa: Lessons for Delhi from Beijing’s Long Game in the Global South
item.description: It would be unfair to compare the roles of the two Asian powers, as India and China differ markedly in perspective and capability. Nevertheless, China’s extensive engagement with Africa offers valuable lessons for India

item.title: How Khamenei regime’s economic failures are bringing about its fall
item.description: Bazaar merchants and the agrarian class, traditionally loyalists of the regime, have joined the anti-regime movement. Massive corruption and the IRGC officials’ mafia-like control over the economy have led to resentment among the business class

item.title: Pakistan’s arms exports: Not an economic breakthrough, but a narrative project
item.description: Pakistan’s sale of JF-17 aircraft and other systems is not a transient burst of export activity, but a deliberate effort to convert battlefield narratives into strategic capital

item.title: Why fall of Ayatollah would neither mean liberalism nor revival of Zoroastrianism for Iran
item.description: Iran’s past is admired precisely because it is mummified — culturally contained and politically non-threatening. This does not mean that the end of the theocratic regime would usher in a revival of the pre-Islamic past or the return of a Western-style democracy

item.title: How US Justice Department disclosures dismantle Pakistan’s ceasefire narrative
item.description: In trying to conceal losses at home while urgently advertising fear abroad, Pakistan has ended up fooling itself more than anyone else. The very lobbying effort meant to contain the crisis has become evidence of its fragility

item.title: How Trump has a strategy in his madness for Greenland
item.description: Greenland, a vast island, occupies a crucial geopolitical position, bridging the US and Europe and straddling the GIUK gap—a maritime passage linking the Arctic to the Atlantic. Rich deposits of oil, gas, and rare-earth minerals further enhance its strategic importance
